solution.text:
In the \(\bigtriangleup \)PQR and \(\bigtriangleup \)SQP
we have, \(\angle \)PQR=\(\angle \) SQP [common]
and \(\frac {PQ}{RQ}=\frac {QS}{QP}\Rightarrow \frac {_{{2*j}}_}{_{j}_}=\frac {_{{4*j}}_}{_{{2*j}}_}=\frac 21\)
Therefore by SAS criteria ,\(\bigtriangleup \)PQR ~ \(\bigtriangleup \)SQP
\(\Rightarrow \frac {RP}{PS}=\frac {RQ}{PQ}=\frac 12\)

content.text:
Two triangles are shown in the figure.
If it is given that QS=_{{4*j}}_ and QP=_{{2*j}}_ and QR=_{j}_
Find the value of \(\frac {RP}{PS}\)
